note.p: Career: Worked in his father's foundry; gave up due to ill health; went to Mexico to study its anthropology and archaeology; published 'Primitive man' (1871); Keeper of the University Museum, Oxford (1883); Reader in Anthropology (1884), then Professor of Anthropology, Oxford University (1896-1909); retired
Council: December 1899 to October 1900, when he retired
Member of Committee formed to consider the formation of a new Academy on 18 January 1900
